hero.title:
Artsy's mission is to make all the world's art accessible to anyone with an Internet connection.

We are a resource for art collecting and education.

sections.title:
The Art World
Online
sections.preamble: To make all the world’s art accesible, Artsy partners with top galleries, museums, institutions, & art fairs. Our growing collection of 140,000+ artworks is one of the largest availabe online and represents the scope of the art world.  We are creating a platform for art-lovers, collectors, students and educators to discover art.

pullBlurb1.h2: Our collection comes from leading galleries and museums around the world

pullBlurb2.h2: We cover international show openings and art fairs
pullBlurb2.p: In striving to make the art world accessible to an international audience, Artsy has focused on providing comprehensive online coverage of art world events around the world. We want to provide a resource to stay informed and see the collections of shows and art fairs before they reach the public.

rightImages.author: Artsy Editorial
rightImages.caption: Kanye West’s Surprise Performance at Design Miami/ Basel: Find Out Which Designers He Loves

rightImages.author: Artsy Editorial
rightImages.caption: Kanye West’s Surprise Performance at Design Miami/ Basel: Find Out Which Designers He Loves

pullBlurb3.h2: Save works and curate sets on Artsy
pullBlurb3.p: Artsy allows you to save and organize any works you find in our collection. “Sets” are customizable collections of works you find on Artsy that can be shared or made completely private.
pullBlurb3.button: Sign up to start a Library

pullBlurb4.p: Making the art world accessible means making our collection availble wherever you go. Our iPhone app allows you to browse, save, and collect from anywhere.

sections.title: Collecting
sections.preamble: Currently there are over 100,000 works available for sale on Artsy provided by our international (**howmany**) gallery partners. These works range in price from under $500 to over $1,000,000, with new ones added every day.

pullBlurb1.h2: How buying art on Artsy Works
pullBlurb1.p: When you're interested in a for-sale work you can contact the gallery to disucss price, availability, and purchase of the work. They will message you back with the information you are interested in. Often, the more information you give the gallery about yourself, the quicker the response will be.  The gallery will help you to arrange shipping to your location, anywhere around world.

pullBlurb2.h2: Early access to fairs and shows
pullBlurb2.p: We have dedicated pages to art fairs and gallery shows where you can browse the collection well before they open to the public. Get a head-start on finding the work that’s right for you.
pullBlurb2.caption: Image courtesy of The Armory Show

pullBlurb3.h2: Follow artists and galleries to receive alerts on new works and shows
pullBlurb3.p: We want to keep you informed on the artists and galleries you love. By following an artist or gallery you will receive weekly emails informing you of shows, news works, and news related to what you follow.

pullBlurb4.h2: We’re here to help you find art
pullBlurb4.p: Artsy specialists are available to all Artsy users, whether you are purchasing your first work or building upon an existing collection. Our specialists join Artsy from leading auction houses, galleries, and museums, and are available to help you find works that you love, with your price range, interests, and current collection in mind. Your specialist can also source works which aren't publicly listed on the site through our international network of gallery partners.

preamble.text: The Art Genome Project is an ongoing study to map the characteristics (known as ‘genes’) that connect the world’s artists and artworks. There are over 500 genes including art-historical movements, subject matter, and formal qualities.

pullBlurb1.h2: Works are given a genome, or set of characteristics
pullBlurb1.p: Our team of art historians and experts works hard to assign various characteristics and subject matter to our works. This allows for amazing possibility of discovery.

exampleWork.title: Little Girl in a Blue Armchair
exampleWork.partner: National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C.

pullBlurb2.h2: Characterstics are used to connect artwork
pullBlurb2.p: Our team of art historians and experts works hard to assign various characteristics and subject matter to our works. This is not a perfect science but allows for amazing possibility of discovery.
